column5: How's the crappy weather affecting your fishing? I'm assuming that weed growth and fish location is off this year and behind a few weeks... I wonder if the bass are behind their romping schedule...  Almost July and it's raining and 60F right now... I was hoping for warm sunny weather for my camping trip.. but i better bring my early season gear...  Global warming, eh? this is last year all over again...
It was 95*F+ here at 5:30 pm today... and hotter than a blistered pinocha in a pepper patch!!!
A cooler spring, yes. Has it adversely affected the bite?  Not in Niagara.

It hasn't really been that cool though.. everyone keeps saying that. I remember very few nights this time of year last year that I could be out in a t-shirt.. this June the majority of nights I can comfortably be out ... sans the mosquitos
I'm betting lots of bass will still be on the beds come opening weekend.
I don't know if this is a true indicator but these flowers (peonies) are at least 12 days later blooming than when I took pictures of them a couple of years ago

Quit yer whining, at least you have open water!!!! Here are some shots my boss took last Thursday on a flight South. I have provided a map with the areas still ice covered for your amusement.  ;D I had planned a trip to the East Arm over the July holiday, but she's still gonna be frozed up!!! It was a long cold winter in these parts.
You can even see ice on the map!!!
That's my awesome photo editing work. I wanted to show where the ice was.
You have some awesome photos in your website. Do you spend the winter up there as well? Kenny G.
Thanks Yep, been living up here full time since the winter of 2005.
